title: How Fans Work
content: - Fans use blades to move air.
The blades are attached to a rotating shaft.
The shaft is powered by a motor.
As the blades rotate, they push air in a specific direction.
image_desc: A diagram of a fan with labeled parts, including the blades, shaft, and motor.
narration: Fans are essential for cooling and ventilation. They work by using blades to move air. The blades are attached to a rotating shaft, which is powered by a motor. As the blades spin, they push air in a specific direction, creating a breeze.
